segment.source: How to Localize the Self-Service Portal Notice Text
segment.target: How to Localize the Self-Service Portal Notice Text

segment.source: How to Localize the Self-Service Portal Notice Text
segment.target: How to Localize the Self-Service Portal Notice Text

segment.source: How to Localize the Self-Service Portal Notice Text
segment.target: How to Localize the Self-Service Portal Notice Text

segment.source: You can configure localized notice text to display to end users by default in the Self-Service Portal.
segment.target: You can configure localized notice text to display to end users by default in the Self-Service Portal.

segment.source: The Notice.txt file that displays the notice text is in the following root directory:
segment.target: The Notice.txt file that displays the notice text is in the following root directory:

segment.source: MBAM Self-Service Install Directory Self Service Website
segment.target: MBAM Self-Service Install Directory Self Service Website

segment.source: To display localized notice text, you create a localized Notice.txt file, and then save it under a specific language folder in the following example directory:
segment.target: To display localized notice text, you create a localized Notice.txt file, and then save it under a specific language folder in the following example directory:

segment.source: MBAM Self-Service Install Directory Self Service Website
segment.target: MBAM Self-Service Install Directory Self Service Website

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You can configure the path by using the NoticeTextPath item in Application Settings.
segment.target: You can configure the path by using the NoticeTextPath item in Application Settings.

segment.source: MBAM displays the notice text, based on the following rules:
segment.target: MBAM displays the notice text, based on the following rules:

segment.source: If you create a localized Notice.txt file in the appropriate language folder, MBAM displays the localized notice text if the default Notice.txt file exists.
segment.target: If you create a localized Notice.txt file in the appropriate language folder, MBAM displays the localized notice text if the default Notice.txt file exists.

segment.source: If the default Notice.txt file is missing, a message displays indicating that the default file is missing.
segment.target: If the default Notice.txt file is missing, a message displays indicating that the default file is missing.

segment.source: If MBAM does not find a localized version of the Notice.txt file, it displays the text in the default Notice.txt file.
segment.target: If MBAM does not find a localized version of the Notice.txt file, it displays the text in the default Notice.txt file.

segment.source: If MBAM does not find a default Notice.txt file, it displays the default text in the Self-Service Portal.
segment.target: If MBAM does not find a default Notice.txt file, it displays the default text in the Self-Service Portal.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If an end user’s browser is set to a language that does not have a corresponding language subfolder or Notice.txt, the text in the Notice.txt file in the following root directory is displayed:
segment.target: If an end user’s browser is set to a language that does not have a corresponding language subfolder or Notice.txt, the text in the Notice.txt file in the following root directory is displayed:

segment.source: MBAM Self-Service Install Directory Self Service Website
segment.target: MBAM Self-Service Install Directory Self Service Website

segment.source: To create a localized Notice.txt file
segment.target: To create a localized Notice.txt file

segment.source: On the server where you configured the Self-Service Portal, create a Language folder in the following example directory, where Language represents the name of the localized language:
segment.target: On the server where you configured the Self-Service Portal, create a Language folder in the following example directory, where Language represents the name of the localized language:

segment.source: MBAM Self-Service Install Directory Self Service Website
segment.target: MBAM Self-Service Install Directory Self Service Website

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Some language folders already exist, so you might not have to create a folder.
segment.target: Some language folders already exist, so you might not have to create a folder.

segment.source: If you do have to create a language folder, see National Language Support (NLS) API Reference for a list of the valid names that you can use for the Language folder.
segment.target: If you do have to create a language folder, see National Language Support (NLS) API Reference for a list of the valid names that you can use for the Language folder.

segment.source: Create a Notice.txt file that contains the localized notice text.
segment.target: Create a Notice.txt file that contains the localized notice text.

segment.source: Save the Notice.txt file in the Language folder.
segment.target: Save the Notice.txt file in the Language folder.

segment.source: For example, to create a localized Notice.txt file in Spanish, save the localized Notice.txt file in the following example directory:
segment.target: For example, to create a localized Notice.txt file in Spanish, save the localized Notice.txt file in the following example directory:

segment.source: MBAM Self-Service Install Directory Self Service WebsiteEs-es
segment.target: MBAM Self-Service Install Directory Self Service WebsiteEs-es

segment.source: The name of the Language folder can also be the language neutral name es instead of es-es.
segment.target: The name of the Language folder can also be the language neutral name es instead of es-es.

segment.source: If the end user’s browser is set to es-es and that folder does not exist, the parent locale (as defined in .NET) is recursively retrieved and checked, resolving to MBAM Self-Service Install DirectorySelfServiceWebsiteesNotice.txt before finally becoming the default Notice.txt file.
segment.target: If the end user’s browser is set to es-es and that folder does not exist, the parent locale (as defined in .NET) is recursively retrieved and checked, resolving to MBAM Self-Service Install DirectorySelfServiceWebsiteesNotice.txt before finally becoming the default Notice.txt file.

segment.source: This recursive fallback mimics the .NET resource loading rules.
segment.target: This recursive fallback mimics the .NET resource loading rules.

segment.target: Got a suggestion for MBAM?

segment.target: Use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
